benchmark_details.name: Biâ€™anBench
benchmark_details.overview: A bilingual (Chinese-English) benchmark for RAG hallucination detection, featuring a dataset and lightweight judge models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the ability of LLMs in detecting hallucinations in RAG outputs across multiple tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The framework excludes creative writing tasks due to their subjective nature.

data.source: Curated from open-source repositories and peer-reviewed datasets.
data.annotation: Included hallucination perturbed samples and counterfactual cases.

methods: Two-stage Training (Supervised Fine-Tuning and Preference Learning)
methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated by matching predicted results with true labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in hallucination detection.
methodology.validation: Results validated against multiple models including GPT-4o.

targeted_risks.harm: Risks of generating incorrect outputs during model assessment.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data does not contain personally identifiable information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All datasets used are sourced from open repositories with proper licenses.
